Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.base

Class AminoAcidsUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.base.AminoAcidsUtility
  • public class AminoAcidsUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which manages all amino acids. NOTE: Syntax of amino acid Spices is single-particle Spices = Backbone or Spices = Backbone(Sidechain), i.e. an amino acids backbone is always represented by 1 particle
    Author:
    Achim Zielesny

      • isOnlySingleParticleAminoAcids

        public boolean isOnlySingleParticleAminoAcids()
        True: All amino acids are represented by SPICES with only one single particle, false: Otherwise (i.e. at least one amino acid is represented by SPICES with two or more particles
        Returns:
        True: All amino acids are represented by SPICES with only one single particle, false: Otherwise (i.e. at least one amino acid is represented by SPICES with two or more particles

        Returns:
        Spices depending on given one letter code

      • getSpicesFromOneLetterCode

        public java.lang.String getSpicesFromOneLetterCode​(java.lang.String aCode)
                                            throws DpdPeptideException
        Gets the particle Spices from given one letter code. The Spices consits only of uncharged particles.
        Parameters:
        aCode - One letter code
        Returns:
        Spices depending on given one letter code.
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • getChargedSpicesFromOneLetterCode

        public java.lang.String getChargedSpicesFromOneLetterCode​(java.lang.Character aCode,
                                                          java.lang.String aChargeArgument)
                                                   throws DpdPeptideException
        Gets the particle Spices from given one letter code. The Spices consists of charged and uncharged particles depending on given charge setting.
        Parameters:
        aCode - One letter code.
        aChargeArgument - A charge argument (S+C-N+, ...)
        Returns:
        Charged Spices
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • setSpicesForAminoAcid

        public void setSpicesForAminoAcid​(java.lang.String anAminoAcid,
                                  java.lang.String aSpices)
                           throws DpdPeptideException
        Sets the particle Spices to the specified amino acid. The Spices describing an amino acid can only consist of the particle names and branches "( )".
        Parameters:
        anAminoAcid - Name of the amino acid.
        aSpices - Spices to set.
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • getUsedParticles

        public java.lang.String[] getUsedParticles()
                                    throws DpdPeptideException
        Returns the set of particles used to describe the amino acids. The Spices describing an amino acid can only consist of the particle names and branches "( )".
        Returns:
        Set of particles.
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException
